solution.text:
First to obtain \(_{k}_x^2\) we multiply the divisor\((_{k}_x+_{l}_)\) by x
secondly to obtain \(_{{k*j}}_x\) we multiply the divisor\((_{k}_x+_{l}_)\) by _{j}_
\(\require{enclose}\begin{array}{r} x+_{j}_ \\[-3pt] _{k}_x+_{l}_\enclose{longdiv}{_{k}_x^2 + _{{k*j+l}}_x + _{{l*j+m}}_} \\[-3pt] \underline{_{k}_x^2+_{l}_x}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{{j*k}}_x+_{{l*j+m}}_ \\[-3pt] \underline{_{{j*k}}_x+_{{l*j}}_}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{m}_\end{array}\)
Therefore Dividend = Divisor \(\times \) Quotient + Remainder
\(\Rightarrow _{k}_x^2 + _{{k*j+l}}_x + _{{l*j+m}}_\) =\((x+_{j}_) \times (_{k}_x+_{l}_)+_{m}_\)

content.text:
Divide \(_{k}_x^2 + _{{k*j+l}}_x + _{{l*j+m}}_\) by \(_{k}_x+_{l}_\)
Choose the option in which the division algorithm is correctly verified
